title: Smashed roasted potatoes with rosemary salt

ingredients.content: 1 - 2 tbsp olive oil, plus extra to serve

preparations.content: Line a baking tray (20 x 30 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place rosemary into mixing bowl and mill <b>1 min/speed 9<b>.

Add salt into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer salt onto prepared baking tray and spread out evenly, then leave to dry out overnight. Transfer salt into a sealable jar or container to store and use as needed.
Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position, then weigh potatoes into it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>25-30 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, or until potatoes are cooked (see tips).
Preheat oven to 200°C. Transfer potatoes onto prepared baking tray, then place into refrigerator to cool and dry out for 30 minutes.

Using a fork, flatten the potatoes onto baking tray slightly. Drizzle with olive oil, then sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of the reserved rosemary salt and fresh rosemary leaves. Roast for 25-30 minutes (200°C) or until brown and crispy.
Transfer potatoes onto a serving platter. Drizzle with a little extra olive oil, sprinkle with extra rosemary salt and serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: In step 5, potatoes should be cooked through but still firm enough that a knife can pass easily through without mashing.
Rosemary salt can be made in advance and stored in a cool, dry place in a sealable storage container until needed.
